result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber Corrao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit And Run-Resulting In Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from any of the defendant's funds at the maximum allowable percentage and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
To be determined.   Hearing November 11, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/weapon.
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber Corrao

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Hearing exhibits from 09-20-2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 793

Case calendared for Restitution Hearing November 11, 2022.  ADA Mike Schindhelm contacted the Court and Attorney Schwantes advising there is no request for restitution from the victim's family.  Matter removed from Court's calendar this date.  bm
Notice of Completion of Representation by Attorney Travis Schwantes received and filed.  bm

Defendant Amber Corrao in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Amber Corrao.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by Ruby A. and Aisha A.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 157 days time served.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA Assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Mental Health Assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Perform 300 hours of community service.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from any of the defendant's prison funds at the maximum allowable percentage and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

Court ordered Defendant's driver's licensed revoked for 5 years.

Restitution to be determined.  Any restitution request is to be filed 10 days prior to the hearing date. 

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/weapon.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights.

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Documentation of Cracked Windshield in 2021 received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Documentation of Planned Camping Trip received and filed.  bm
Letter of Support received and filed.  bm
Letter to Victim's Family from Defendant received and filed.  bm
Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.  bm

Defendant Amber Corrao in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Amber Corrao in custody.  Jennifer Tate for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
State's offer placed on the record.  State compliant with victim notification.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised Defendant as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm/weapon and she may not vote until her civil rights are restored.  Defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm

Defendant Amber Corrao in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Amber Corrao in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  State turned over Discovery.  Defense requested Plea Hearing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amber Corrao in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Amber Corrao in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Zoom.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Arraignment and Bail/Bond .  Defense enters Not Guilty Plea.  Bail motion by State and Defense argued and Denied by the Court; Bail remains the same.  Defense request time for review.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Received and Filed. nk

09:42 AM Defendant Amber Corrao in court with Attorney Travis Schwantes; both appear by video.  Defendant Amber Corrao in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Schnier.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. State requests an arraignment date.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Arraignment scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel. Received and Filed. nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license or vaild insurance.

Defendant Amber Corrao in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Amber Corrao in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amber Corrao appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
